Key Match Events: Ceddanne Rafaela triple off New York starter Luis Severino that snuck under the glove of a diving, overly aggressive Brandon Nimmo in center
Francisco Lindor reached on a single in the bottom half of the third inning, and Nimmo laced a ball to Duran in center. Duran came in, but the ball sailed over his head. Lindor scored for a 2-1 lead
Connor Wong dropped a Jeff McNeil foul ball in the fourth inning

Luis Torrens then tagged a Bello offering to left. The ball landed down the line near Tyler O’Neill, who appeared as though he had a play, but coasted to the spot. O’Neill tried to backhand the ball on a hop, but it deflected off his glove. Stewart scored from first on the error
Lindor then delivered the final blow in that inning with an RBI single
Pre-Game Insights: Alex Cora, manager, highlighted the importance of strong bullpen performance
Cora mentioned that they have lost their last three, eight of their last 11, and are 13-17 since Aug. 1
Post-Match Reflections: Cora stated, 'We’re running out of time. Let’s put it that way'
Devers grounded out to second in the eighth inning after a wild pitch moved both runners into scoring position
Miscellaneous Highlights: Trevor Story's shoulder injury highlights the team's defensive issues
Lindor hit the fastest pitch recorded in MLB history
O'Neill, a two-time Gold Glove winner with the Cardinals, has committed seven errors in just 80 outfield games this season
